profile.name: Sergio
profile.description:
I like to think myself as a full stack developer. 
	
However, for the past 5 years I have being focused on JVM Development on the backend. I am a core committer of both open source frameworks Micronaut.io and Grails.org. Moreover, since late 2021 I am the Developer Advocate of 2GM (Groovy, Grails Micronaut) practice at Object Computing Inc. 
	
Before that, I developed applications (both iOS and Android), built websites for small to medium businesses. From Wordpress to static websites to custom web applications. I have been self employed since 2008. First I was consulting, then I had a startup for 3 years.   
	
I like HTML and CSS and the web.
	
I like to write. I used to write a newsletter (https://groovycalamari.com). Nowadays, I write in my blog (https://sergiodelamo.com). 
	
I like podcasts. Moreover, I am currently the host of two podcasts (https://micronautpodcast.com and http://codigobot.com) which I self publish. 
	
I have done public speaking both in conferences, user groups and online events. I teach Micronaut and Grails training. 
	
Dream, I would like to release a Software a Service application. Design it, code it, control every decision around it. Basecamp (37 Signals) have always been an inspiration to me.

Working for Apple would another dream. 

I have two kids (6 and 3). I live in Guadalajara, Spain. I have my family network here and I don't see myself moving or commuting to work anytime soon. I have been working remotely for the past 5 years. 

I am all-in on the Apple Ecosystem. I purchase a lot of Apple products. I like to consume Apple news (sixcolors.com and daringfireball.net) and related podcasts (Upgrade or Mac Power users - https://www.relay.fm/upgrade or https://www.relay.fm/mpu) are among my favorite podcasts. 
	
I like chess and poker but I have not played for the past several years.
